snippet: After World War II, Zosa Szajkowski scoured the bombed-out streets of Europe for paperwork to send home to Jewish institutions — a kind of revenge for wartime atrocities.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; book The Archive Thief: The Man Who Salvaged French Jewish History in the Wake of the Holocaust by Lisa Moses Leff, analyzes what motivated Zosa Szajkowski to obsessively collect Nazi-government paperwork that became valuable trove of archival material for those studying Judaica.
lead_paragraph: After World War II, Zosa Szajkowski scoured the bombed-out streets of Europe for paperwork to send home to Jewish institutions — a kind of revenge for wartime atrocities.

headline.main: The Man Who Stole Nazi-Era History From the Streets
headline.print_headline: Stealing Nazi History From Bombed-Out Streets

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Archive Thief: The Man Who Salvaged French Jewish History in the Wake of the Holocaust (Book)
